title: JdVeP
author: JdVeP
content: This person scammed me 150€https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5402186.0After having said on his topic : I wait to be delivered after having paid, no answer from him either on gmail or on the topic, it was locked.https://www.noelshack.com/2022-24-3-1655276209-gmailproof.png

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: JdVeP on June 15, 2022, 06:56:00 AMThis person scammed me 150€https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5402186.0Leave him negative feedback and/or create a Flag against him.I don't get why people still fall for this: What made you think sending money to a Newbie with a self-moderated topic was a good idea?

comments.author: JdVeP
comments.created_time: June 15, 2022, 08:23:08 AMLast edit: June 15, 2022, 09:45:28 AM by JdVeP
comments.body: I wait every ~10 minutes for send it bad negative review  but i have always this message The last posting from your IP was less than 360 seconds ago. Please try again later. The thing you were trying to post was saved as a draft. This limit decreases substantially as your account becomes more established.edit : ok it work now, thanks

comments.author: rozak
comments.body: OP, maybe you could attach a screenshot of your conversation in Email. or proof of delivery of your BTC. it is to make sure that you are indeed doing a transaction with the accused.I also do not know. You make transactions on the forum with a newbie account. how can you believe it? Of course, it's very risky.edit, sorry I didn't read it carefully.

comments.author: JdVeP
comments.body: Now this scum say "it's sold" .  I already do that on another forum, thought it was the same trust here.. i was wrong.cya

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: JdVeP on June 15, 2022, 03:36:23 PMNow this scum say "it's sold" .  Post history (before edited) can be seen here https://ninjastic.space/post/60334388Quote from: JdVeP on June 15, 2022, 03:36:23 PM-snip-I already do that on another forum, thought it was the same trust here.. i was wrong.cyaDo you mean you have transacted with the same username in other forums and it went smoothly? Actually this is a bit late, but I warn you that impersonators have a hobby of being a reputable trader. You should not move if you have good experience trading in previous forum.Sorry for your losses

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Have you exchanged any DMs on the forum? How have you made the deal and sent the funds? Post it here if have forum chat history and transaction id, so we might take a look at that. Based on current evidence hard to tag though I am assuming it was a scam. Why should you trust random users without good trading history? Why you hadn't used the escrow service? A lot of scammers around the forum, just be careful and learn from the mistakes.

comments.author: skarais
comments.body: Quote from: The Cryptovator on June 15, 2022, 06:46:04 PMHave you exchanged any DMs on the forum?Looks like the OP did the deal via PM, as he only replied to one post on that topic after payment was made: https://ninjastic.space/post/60360938QuoteI paid and I'm still waitingQuote from: The Cryptovator on June 15, 2022, 06:46:04 PMWhy should you trust random users without good trading history? Why you hadn't used the escrow service? A lot of scammers around the forum, just be careful and learn from the mistakes.It's a beginner's mistake, they don't realize that trusting random people about money is wrong. Without escrow everything falls apart unless the seller is really a trusted person based on his reputation. The OP should learn in the future no matter how much the money is worth, he should try to have escrow to handle his trades if done with random people.
